text: This is a list with brief descriptions of Topps sports card products for 1971. ==Baseball== {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |Base set | |752 |2.5 x |- |Coin Inserts | |153 | diameter |- |Greatest Moments | |55 |2.5 x |- |Topps Super | |63 |5.25 x |- |Bazooka Numbered Test | |48 |2 x | |- |Bazooka Unnumbered | |36 |2 x | |- |} ===Parallel Sets=== Since 1965, the Canadian candy company O-Pee-Chee produced virtually identical, but smaller, sets identical to the Topps issue of the same year. The Canadian printed cards were printed on grey cardstock and featured French and English text on the reverse. The 1971 set featured yellow backs rather than green used by Topps, as well as some with a different design. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |O-Pee-Chee | |752 |2.5 x |- |} ==Football== In 1971, Topps issued several Football sets featuring the National Football League. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |Base set | |263 |2.5 x |- |Game Inserts | |53 |2.25 x |- |Posters Inserts | |32 |4.875 X |- |Bazooka | |36 cards/12 panels of 3 |1.9375 x 2.625/2.625 x 5.875 |- |} ==Hockey== {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |Base set | |132 |2.5 x |- |} ==Basketball== Topps issued two sets featuring the two professional basketball leagues, the National Basketball Association and the American Basketball Association, playing during the 1971-1972 season. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text- align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |Base set | |233 |2.5 x |- |Trios Stickers | |26 |2.5 x |- |} ==References== * Beckett, Dr. James et al.
